main

Class Interpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Interpreter

  • public class Interpreter
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Barry Warnock Interpreter takes the text from the gui and runs it as an idiot program

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static javax.swing.JTextArea io 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interpreter()
      The interpreter constructor does nothing but explicitly set the JTextArea used for i/o to null

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void logToIo(java.lang.String message)
      all calls to append are called through this method which uses SwingUtilities.invokeLater to ensure that appending to a JTextArea in another thread doesn't lock up the GUI
      void run(java.lang.String content)
      run goes through the text from the gui line by line, turning each line into a Command object and checking for errors along the way.
      void setIo(javax.swing.JTextArea io)
      setIo is used to bind i/o to the desired JTextArea

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • io

        protected static javax.swing.JTextArea io

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interpreter

        Interpreter()
        The interpreter constructor does nothing but explicitly set the JTextArea used for i/o to null

    • Method Detail

      • setIo

        public void setIo(javax.swing.JTextArea io)
        setIo is used to bind i/o to the desired JTextArea
        Parameters:
        io - the JTextArea to use for i/o

      • logToIo

        public static void logToIo(java.lang.String message)
        all calls to append are called through this method which uses SwingUtilities.invokeLater to ensure that appending to a JTextArea in another thread doesn't lock up the GUI
        Parameters:
        message - the text to be printed to the i/o console

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String content)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        run goes through the text from the gui line by line, turning each line into a Command object and checking for errors along the way.

        if no errors are found then the linked list on Commands is run though until they have all been executed

        Parameters:
        content - the IDIOT code to be interpreted
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - run throws an exception if no JTextArea has been set for i/o yet
